intro: Diplopterygium glaucum, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and stream sides.
